page.title: 05FEATURES PAST & PRESENT
page.content: The shields show the Fincham Arms. The ancient Piscina in the wall of the chapel was used to wash the linen & the cups. The latten Lectern held music for the choir boys it was made before brass was invented. The Alms Box is a funny looking box which is probably unique in England. It stands in the South Aisle Chapel. The alms box is very old and was used for collecting money from women at the church. The money was dropped in different openings according to whether the child was male,female or if the lady had twins.There is also a door to obtain access to the contents.There is an interesting room called a parvis above the entrance porch which was used as a school room & a guest room for visiting Clergymen.
